title: Ray Anthony - 2007 - Young Ideas_Moments Together FLAC
description:
Ray Anthony - 2007 - Young Ideas_Moments Together

Ray Anthony played two years with Glenn Miller and ten with Jimmy Dorsey before forming his own band. Anthony led a group in the Pacific during World War II, then had a highly popular dance band. He probably has as much fame, if not more, as the writer of the theme for Dragnet, the novelty tune "The Bunny Hop," and the hit single "Dancing in the Dark." He also had plenty of film and TV work in the '50s, including an appearance in the film Daddy Long Legs. (AllMusic)

14 - Careless
15 - Everything I have is yours
16 - Many faces

26 - The lonely trumpet

Personnel:
Tracks 1,3-4 & 8-9: Ray Anthony, Art DePew, Jack Laubach, Jack Holmann (tp), Jimmy Henderson, Lewis McGreery, Jimmy Priddy (tb), Med Flory (cl, as), Gene Merlino (as, vcl), Bob Enevoldsen, Jeff Massingill (ts), Leo Anthony (bar), Goeff Clarkson (p), Al Viola (g), Don Simpson (b, arr), Bill Richmond (d), plus four unidentified cellos. George Williams (arr). April 8,1957.
Tracks 2,6-7 & 10: Same personnel as above. April 10,1957.
Tracks 5,11-12 & 25: Same personnel as above but Ken Trimble (tb) replaces Jimmy Henderson. April 22,1957.
Tracks 24 & 26: Ray Anthony, Ray Linn, Jack Holmann, Knobby Lee (tp), Jimmy Henderson, Lewis McGreery, Jimmy Priddy (tb), Med Flory (cl, as), Gene Merlino (as, vcl), Bob Enevoldsen, Jeff Massingill (ts), Leo Anthony (bar), Paul Smith (p), Al Viola (g), Don Simpson (b, arr), Bill Richmond (d). The Ray Anthony Chorus (vcl). May 15,1957.
Tracks 13,16,18 & 23: Same personnel as above. June 4,1957.
Tracks 14-15,17 & 19-22: Same personnel as above. June 7,1957.

Enjoy and share!
